concise_definition: v. 谈判, 协商, 讨价还价

definitions.explanation_en: To engage in discussions with one or more parties with the aim of reaching an agreement, often involving compromise on terms, conditions, or demands.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指与一方或多方面进行讨论，旨在达成协议，通常涉及在条款、条件或要求上做出妥协。
definitions.example_en: The union is negotiating a new contract with management to improve working conditions.
definitions.example_cn: 工会正在与管理层谈判一份新合同，以改善工作条件。

definitions.explanation_en: To successfully arrange or secure something through discussion or persuasion, especially when the outcome is uncertain or difficult to obtain.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过讨论或说服成功安排或获得某物，尤其当结果不确定或难以取得时。
definitions.example_en: She negotiated a lower price for the car after hours of discussion.
definitions.example_cn: 经过数小时的讨论，她成功将汽车价格谈低了。

definitions.explanation_en: To move carefully or skillfully through a difficult or complex situation, often implying tact or diplomacy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指谨慎或巧妙地应对复杂或困难的局面，常暗示使用技巧或外交手段。
definitions.example_en: He was negotiating the narrow hallway with the large painting, careful not to scratch the walls.
definitions.example_cn: 他正小心翼翼地抱着大幅画作穿过狭窄的走廊，生怕刮到墙壁。

comparison.analysis: “Bargaining” (讨价还价) 通常特指在价格或物质利益上的反复磋商，语义范围较窄，多用于商业或日常交易场景。而 “negotiating” 范围更广，可涵盖政策、条款、关系等非价格因素，且更强调双方的互动与策略。
“Discussing” (讨论) 仅指交换意见或信息，不必然导向协议或结果。而 “negotiating” 隐含明确的目标——达成共识或协议，具有更强的目的性和结果导向性。
“Mediating” (调解) 指第三方介入帮助双方达成协议，而 “negotiating” 是指直接参与方之间的互动。谈判者是利益相关方，调解者则是中立的协调者，角色本质不同。
